meanings.definition: The outer edge of a circular object
meanings.sent1: The rim of the plate was decorated with tiny flowers.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed the cup on the rim of the table.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the rim of the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the rim of the mountains, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The child traced her finger along the rim of the glass, fascinated by its smoothness.

meanings.definition: To form or be situated on the edge of something
meanings.sent1: They decided to rim the garden with colorful stones.
meanings.sent2: The river rimmed the small town, providing a natural barrier.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to rim the dessert plate with chocolate sauce for an elegant touch.
meanings.sent4: His excitement rimmed his eyes as he gazed at the finished painting.
meanings.sent5: The laughter rimmed the room as friends shared stories around the campfire.
